intro: Urostachys subulatus, commonly known as the needle-leaved saxifrage, is a flowering plant native to arctic and alpine regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is characterized by its narrow, needle-like leaves and small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cold, harsh environments. It is often found in mountainous areas and is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family. Urostachys subulatus is known for its resilience and is sometimes used in horticulture for its ornamental value.
